questions.question: 1. In which of the following scattering(s), the incident and scattered light has the same wavelength?

explanations.a: Tyndall scattering is an elastic scattering and does not absorb any energy from the incident radiation. Rayleigh scattering absorbs negligible energy from the incident radiation.
explanations.b: Raman scattering can absorb or emit energy into the incident radiation.
explanations.c: Brillouin scattering absorbs energy from incoming radiation.

questions.question: 2. Particles showing tyndall effect has diameter compared to wavelength on incident radiation (ƛ):

explanations.a: particles having diameter smaller than ƛ/10 show rayleigh scattering
explanations.b: particles having diameter greater than ƛ/10 show Mei scattering
explanations.c: particles having diameter smaller than ƛ also show Mei scattering
explanations.d: particles having diameter greater than ƛ show tyndall scattering

questions.question: 3. Why does violet color scatter more than red color in the sky?

answers.a: Violet color is abundant in the incoming radiation from sun
answers.b: Air molecules like N<sub>2</sub>, O<sub>2</sub> have diameter which are of the order ƛ/10 or less and they scatter violet more than red.
answers.c: violet color is refracted more by the atmospheric layers.
answers.d: red color is absorbed by the air molecules.

explanations.a: all range of frequency is present in the incoming radiation in the same amount.
explanations.b: the intensity of scattered light varies as V2/λ4  (i.e., proportional to the square of particle volume, V, or to the sixth power of diameter, and inversely as the fourth power of wavelength, λ). Therefore, for a given particle size, violet light is scattered about eight to ten times more than red light.
explanations.c: refraction does not play an important role in the higher intensity of violet color
explanations.d: red color is not absorbed by air molecules.

questions.question: 4. Why do metal particles do not show scattering generally?

answers.a: metal particles absorb more and scatter less.
answers.b: metal particles are smaller than  λ/10.

explanations.a: metal particles absorb more and scatter less, due to which absorption dominates over scattering when particle size is small.
explanations.b: metal particles are comparable to N<sub>2</sub> and O<sub>2</sub> and should show the same effect as them if they are insulating and non absorbing
explanations.c: metal particles like other particles scatter too, but their absorption dominates over scattering.
